titlestmt.titleproper: Mazer (June L.) Lesbian Archives Mazer Collection of Video Materials
Finding aid for the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives Collection of Video Materials, 1980-2005 LSC.2231
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kimberlee Granholm, Daniel Williford, Miranda Larsen.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: Finding aid description and metadata in this record are licensed under a Creative Commons Public Domain Designation (CC0 1.0 Universal). See LSC's Metadata Rights Statement for more information.

change.item: Added ARK, matched front matter with Catalog Record (CC).

did.unittitle: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives Collection of Video Materials
did.abstract: This collection of videos includes commercial and home made productions that touch on issues of feminism, lesbians, and relevant LGBT topics. Videos were culled from the personal collections of individuals such as Diane Germain, Ester Bentley, and Angela Brinskele.
did.physloc: COLLECTION STORED ON-SITE: Collection is currently being digitized. Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. If you have questions about this material please email AskLSC@library.ucla.edu.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Collection is currently being digitized. Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. If you have questions about this material please email spec-coll@library.ucla.edu.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives Collection of Video Material (Collection 2231). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Processed by Kimberlee Granholm, Daniel Williford, Miranda Larsen, 2012-2014.

The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This collection of videos includes commercial and home made productions that touch on issues of feminism, lesbians, and broader LGBT related topics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Videos were culled from the personal collections of individuals such as Diane Germain, Ester Bentley, and Angela Brinskele.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged according to original provenance or collection from which they were culled.

relatedmaterial.head: Location Note
relatedmaterial.p: Ester F. Bentley papers (Collection 1981). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
Diane Germain papers (Collection 1961). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
Angela Brinskele photographs (Collection 2158). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.
Old Lesbians Organizing for Change records (Collection 2203). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

Southern California Women for Understanding (SCWU) collection (Collection 2203). Available at UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #3] Interview with Bridget Wilson and Kim McAlister.

[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #6] Interview: "Las Hermanas" (Marinel Weaver, Roberta Gonzales-Gregg, Teresa Oyos, and Virginia Martins); Johnola Hughes; "Paige" Brown.

[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #8] Interview with "Paige" Brown.
[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #9] Interview with Bonnie Zimmerman and Sue Palmer.
[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #10] Interview with Diane F. Germain and Pam Wilson; Cory Baca and Karen Merry; Deanne Gauthier and Kathy Moore.
[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #11] Interview with Cynthia Laurence-Wallace and Peggy Heathers.
[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #12] Interview with Cynthia Laurence-Wallace and Peggy Heathers.

[A Lesbian Decade: The San Diego Seventies, Tape #14] Overview.
[Herstorical Snippets: Diane and Teacher Protest, 5-28-2004] San Diego teachers rally against health care benefits cuts.--Recording of Manny & Lo.

[Herstorical Snippets: Ellen Show news reports] San Diego local news reports on lesbian and gay people watching the "herstorical" Ellen Show when she "came out," including Diane Germain, Pamela Gusha, and Gayle Feldman.
[Herstorical Snippets: Hate Flyers] Diane Germain speaks about racist flyers posted in Hillcrest. Also contains partial recording of the movie "China Girl."

[Herstorical Snippets: Mental Health, Asian Women] Cross Cultural Issues workshop #2, seminar on refugees. Diane Germain (UCSD Medical Center, social worker) asks questions about why women don't receive mental health care.
[Herstorical Snippets: Myth California Arrest] Germain is arrested protesting the "Myth California Pageant" for littering corn flakes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ann Simonton (Santa Cruz) in corn flakes box is also arrested. In total, 11 women and 1 man are arrested.--Catherine Johns (San Diego) has a panel discussion on beauty pageants. Germain (Califia Community Collective) and Abbie Padgett (NOW, ACLU) speak about the objectification of women for profit.--Report on settlement that three women receive a year later after being arrested unjustly.

did.unittitle: [Herstorical Snippets: Ann Simonton "Myth California"] Fred Lewis interviews with Ann Simonton (Director of Myth California protests, former bathing suit model for Sports Illustrated).--Germain arrested--Germain and Padgett discuss the pageant.
[Herstorical Snippets: Lesbian Cartoonist] Linda Gibbins of "Our World" Television interviews Diane F. Germain, lesbian cartoonist.
Tape content descriptions
2 Unlabeled Super 8 tapes
Curation Series: Angela Brinskele
Mazer Festival - Room of Our Own #1 of 3
[Italian American Women's Reading at Mama Bear's, Oakland]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From box: Produced by Francesca Roccaforte, Camera by Debra Arbuckle, Gable. With Giovanna (Janet) Capone, Lucia Chiavola Birnbaum, Sabina Magilocco, Corva Rose Radici.

did.unittitle: [Dykes and Their Dogs] Starring Carleasei (MC), Clancey (Trickster), Ester Bently (Prizemaker),and The Dogbreath Band. Produced and written by Mary jo Godgess and Renee Sotile; World Premiere at Los Angeles' Outfest 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From box: "An uproarious musical/comedy Dykeumentary about the popular Dykes and Their Dogs contest held annually in West Hollywood, California. This is not just another day in the park. With contest categories showcasing: Most Butch, Most Femme, Best Singer, Best Kisser and Best Owner-Look-Alike, it is hard to distinguish who is really performing the tricks, the Dykes or the Dogs. Filled with a rainbow of characters, some four-legged, some two-legged, and some "somewhere in between." Unconditional love sets a resounding tone. The original soundtrack literally Pants & Howls with the title track anthem, "I'm a Dyke, I'm a Dog!!! A veritable sing-a-long whether you are a Dyke, or a Dog, or "somewhere in between.""

did.unittitle: [Bessie, Billie, & Ruth] "Divas Breaking Taboos," starring Renee Sotile and Mary Jo Godges.
[Lipstick Lesbians]

[Lesbian Images] A class by Lauren Jardine: pictures various interviews with lesbians and lesbian couples talking about their own experience as lesbians (in their youth and at present). Video by Linmar Productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Lesbian Images] A class by Lauren Jardine: pictures various interviews with lesbians and lesbian couples talking about their own experience as lesbians (in their youth and at present). Video by Linmar Productions.

did.unittitle: [Que Sera] A collection of footage and memorabilia from Que Sera (once a popular Long Beach bar for lesbians), 1975-1995. Features a performance by the Que Serettes.
[Texas Bullsh!t] By Renee Sotile and Mary Jo Godges.
[Greetings from Washington D.C.] March on Washington, 1979.
[Presentation of Plaques, June Mazer]
[Hearts & Hands; A Stitch in Time; Remember My Name; The Way We Wear]
[Miscellaneous Queer TV Coverage] Recording includes: Propaganda Film, Cammemeyer testimony, Achtenberg debate, gay and lesbian issues, accuracy in the media.
[Lesbian and Gay Youth Video Project--British Youth]
[Oprah interviews]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Episode recordings of Oprah: interview with lesbian women (1987, includes Yolanda Ritter on panel) and a special on "Coming Out" in honor of National Coming Out Day (1989). Transfer also contains the movie "Entre nous" (1983).

did.unittitle: [Geraldo episodes]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Geraldo/Cheryl Crane interview, "Gays in Uniform" Geraldo episode (May 1988), and "Lesbian and Gay Rights" (1987)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From tape: Lesbian/gay marriages, Larry King reparative therapy, Brain Study LeVey, In the Shadow of Love, Teen Aids, Cher Bio, Dear John Episode, Stop the Church, Protests AB101 (A. Donnahoe, C.Fisher, Lily Tomlin), Discussion on Aids Ten Years Later.

did.unittitle: [In My Own Words] The story of the first African-American woman to gain entrace into the INternational Brotherhood of Electrical Workers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also labeled as "Against All Odds: Women in the Trades." Attributed to Neshtey Crudup, Lynn Dabney, and Vivian Price.

did.unittitle: [West Hollywood City Channel 10] Labeled "1.9" and Show #3."
[Tiny & Ruby: Hell Divin' Wimmon]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pictures legendary jazz trumpeter Tiny Davis and her partner of over 40 years, drummer-pianist Ruby Lucas. Produced and directed by Greta Schiller and Andrea Weiss.

did.unittitle: [Long Beach Lesbian and Gay Pride] Long Beach parade with Mazer board member Cheryl Nassar.
[Various TV News Clips] Miscellaneous television recordings on lesbian/gay marriage, brain studies, domestic partners, Cher, AIDS, AB101 and protests.
Archives Building Fund - A Short Videotape. LHEF (Lesbian Herstory Educational Foundation).
Mazer Festival- A Room of Our Own
Mazer Festival - Room of Our Own #2 of 3
Mazer & Cool Sponsored Panel Discussion at Plummer Park, West Hollywood

scopecontent.p: A Celebration of the Life of Audre Lorde

West Coast Celebration Sunday OLOC
Vera Martin's 75th Birthday. Video by Cristina Vegas
In the Life
Rachel Rosenthal Life & Times
The Sisterhood Bookstore 25th Anniversary Celebration, with Gloria Steinem, Bell Hooks, Sheila Kuehl, Maxine Waters, Emily Levine, Eloise Klein Healy, Jackie Goldberg, and Robin Tyler.
[Tret Fure; Chris Williamson; 1st Part of Gloria Allred]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Musical performances, brief speeches/commentary, comedic acts. Topics ranging from being drug free, discussion of the imprisonment of women, classism, social justice, and creating women-only safe spaces.

did.unittitle: Diane's Humor at SOL - Diane Makes Jokes
Lesbian Health Heros Thanks Diane! by Cindy Nelson
BLT Lesbian Delights
G. Steinam
[Get Used To It - "Education"] Episode #20 of the TV program Get Used To It, focused on education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hosted by Sheila James Kuehl; guests Jeff Horton and Bonnie Castrey. Contains interview with Jackie Goldberg, lesbian member of the Los Angeles City Council and former member of the Los Angeles Unified School District Board. Discussion of LGBT youth/students, allies, administrators, teachers, etc. Topics include tolerance, sexual education, dress codes, prom, and multicultural integration. Aired 11/15/1994, filmed at 8611 Santa Monica Blvd, West Hollywood, California.

did.unittitle: [Pride Divide] By Paris Poirier and Karen Kiss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A multicity work focusing on men and women in LGBT history. Topics include community formation and rivalry, police persecution, HIV/AIDS, legal issues, myths and stereotypes, and contesting opinions. Includes a vast group of speakers: Joan Nestle, Nadine Smith, Eric Gutirrez, Kate Clinton, Joanne Lulan, Camille Paglia, Eric Morris, Harry Hay, Rose Trouche, Michael Musto, Jim Kepner, Sarah Pettit, Torie Osborn, Phyllis Lyon, Del Martin, Barbara Gittings, and Lillian Faderman.

did.unittitle: [Richard's Things]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From the tape: "Gloomy drama about a widow who gets seduced by her late husband's girlfriend." Starring Liv Ulmann, Amanda Redman, and David Markham. Based on Frederic Raphael's novel of the same name. Directed by Anthony Harvey.

did.unittitle: [Women Are Not Cartoons]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Play with small cast comprised of various roles and vignettes. Topics include honesty in relationships, sexual openness, friendship, flirtation, etc. Repeated use of fade to black with audio overlay - not a technical glitch.

did.unittitle: [Dykes on Mikes]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Musical performances and brief commentary. Note on VHS label puts runtime at 1 hour 55 minutes, but video and audio cut out completely after 48 minutes of play. Intermittent picture interruption and glitches.

did.unittitle: [No On 64 - Stop LaRouche]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Actress Patty Duke pleads with Californians to vote no on Proposition 64, the initiative to restore AIDS to the list of communicable diseases.

did.unittitle: [The Woman's Building: Women's Video Access Workshop Summer 1987 - "Successful Women: Options, Choices, Solutions"]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Overview of various women-oriented services in Los Angeles, such as THE (To Help Everyone) Clinic, Alcoholism Center for Women, Chicana Service Action Center, Connexus, and the Girls Club of Santa Monica/Bay Area.

did.unittitle: [Shasta Woman - The Story of Norma Jean Croy]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Video detailing case information of Norma Jean Croy, a Native American woman wrongfully sentenced to life in prison for first degree murder in 1978. Diane Samuelson, a defense team attorney, narrates frequently. Interviews with Norma Jean Croy, Johnell Sanchez, Nilak Butler, and Yvonne Swan Sinixt. Discussion of Native American life in California, racial profiling, the legal/justice system, and life in prison.

did.unittitle: [Lesbian Physicians on Practice, Patients, & Power]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interviews with medical students and medical professionals. Topics include coming out to patients, issues in medical education, the work/home divide, and other unique challenges faced by lesbians in the medical field.

did.unittitle: ["World of Light: A Portrait of May Sarton"]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Extended talk with poet/author May Sarton about her work and life. Themes include endurance, fan letters, her relationship with her mother, metaphor, women's literature, and the legacy of her writing. Includes footage of Sarton walking through the woods, visiting the post office, smoking, talking with others, gardening, reading her work, etc.

did.unittitle: [Concert Highlights of Olivia Records 15th Anniversary]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anniversary concert for Olivia Records, a collective for women's music. Includes brief interviews and commentary. Participants include Deidre McCalla, Dianne Davidson, Tret Fure, Lucie Blue Tremblay, and Cris Williamson. Produced by Kathy Wolfe and Judy Dlugacz. Video is often poor and image cuts out intermittently.

did.unittitle: [Gloria Allred; Margaret Gomez; Mother Tongue Reader's Theater; Workshops; Lynn Lavner]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Gloria Allred speaking about the 1983 Papa Choux discrimination case, and talking with audience members afterward. Various acts including comedian Margaret Gomez and the Mother Tongue Reader's Theater. Video cuts off abruptly and switches to numerous workshops at a camp rally in Georgia. Topics in the workshops include the family unit, political activism, nuclear proliferation, discrimination, and feminism. Video cuts to performance of lesbian comedian/performer Lynn Lavner.

did.unittitle: [Tour of the Mazer Collection] Interviews with volunteers including Jo Duffy, Irene Walt, and Lauren Hines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Content includes background on June L. Mazer, community involvement in the collection, and an overview of holdings including posters, buttons, publications, pulp novels, fiction books, ephemera, and the video collection.

did.unittitle: [Flo Kennedy; Cassie Culver; Brown Bag Theater]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flo Kennedy discussing letters, the intersection of love and sex, fundraising, personal empowerment, the presidential election of 1984 (particularly the Mondale-Ferraro ticket), Vanessa Williams' Miss America scandal, and interacting with the audience. Lesbian feminist singer Cassie Culver performs various songs and explains the political/social messages behind them. The Brown Bag Theater group performs on the topics of identity and womanhood in relation to alcoholism.

did.unittitle: [Claudia's Birthday Party] Informal footage of a birthday party.
[Califia Talent Show]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Highlights of the 1985 Califia (women's community) talent show. Begins with an overview of the camp and various activities, including crafts, family time, and remembrances. Performers include Kate Rosenblatt (guitar), Alice Eldred (yodeling), along with dramatic readings, poetry, and various musical and comedy sketches.

did.unittitle: [Closets Are Health Hazards: Lesbian and Gay Physicians Come Out]
[Lavender Underground #2; Chumash Pow Wow]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage from Lavender Underground #2, Valentine's Day Weekend, February of 1993. MC Jean Wiley, with performances by Cindy Kallet and others. / Footage from the Chumash (Native American) Pow Wow in Baldwin Park, California, c.a. 1990.

did.unittitle: [TV Clips - After Stonewall; NBC News; Cheryl Crane; Lynn Scher/Katherine Lee Bates]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: After Stonewall (airdate August 18, 2000) on Los Angeles KCET. Special examining the social and political aftermath of the Stonewall Riots in 1969. NBC News - August 23, 2000. Coverage of a lesbian couple who was asked to leave Dodger Stadium after complaints about them kissing, and the Stadium's subsequent apology. Cheryl Crane interview on Larry King Live August 8, 2001. CSPAN Book TV from December 16, 2001 with Lynn Scher (America the Beautiful) and Katherine Lee Bates.

did.unittitle: [Gay Cable TV] Various clips from GCN, the Gay Cable Network.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes news coverage and interviews concerning multiple gay pride events and AIDS awareness events. In-depth coverage of Gay Pride Day at King's Island Amusement Park. Also, coverage of the national march on Washington about AIDS, gay civil rights, and racism. Features information about the Names Project quilt exhibition in Cincinnati, Ohio; multiple quilts bearing names and designs representative of significant contributors to LGBT history.

did.unittitle: [Califia Talent Show - Autumn 1984]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Highlights from the Califia (women's community) talent show. Performers are unidentified. Performances include singing, dramatic readings, and comedy. Multiple singing acts are choreographed with sign language.

did.unittitle: [Olivia Cruise to the Caribbean]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Highlights of a 1990 Olivia Cruises journey to the Caribbean. Notable clips include dancing, a wedding, brief comedy acts, and a costume party.

did.unittitle: [Kay Weaver, Gini Clemmen, Joanna Cazden]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Performances at a Women's Camp festival, including camp announcements and comedic MC performances between musical acts. Special recognition given to multiple sign language interpreters for providing access to women with hearing difficulties.

did.unittitle: [9 Clips]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: From the VHS tape's case. 1 - "An amusing animated short celebrating black culture by focusing on black hairstyles. Produced by Ayoka Chenzira." 2 - Illusions. "The story of creative black women who are pitted against a Hollywood studio during WWII also examines the reasons behind the absence of black figures in American cinematic history. Written, directed, and produced by Julie Dash." 3 - Red Rwa. "Inspired and made in memory of Kalbinder Kaur Hayre, a young Asian woman who was killed by three racist youth, this program explored the shared experiences of oppression among ethnic groups in Britain. Produced by Prathibha Parmer." 4 - "Lesbians nominated at 1989 Grammy Awards: Tracy Chapman, Melissa Etheridge." 5 - "USA Today: Lesbian Parents; Legal Problems" from 3/6/1989. 6 - To a Safer Place. "The Story of Shirley Turcotte, a woman who was sexually abused as a child and her brave efforts to make peace with her past." 7 - Indians, Outlaws, and Angie Debo. "Angie Debo, at 95, recounts her move to Oklahoma in a covered wagon, and how she became a champion for Indian rights." 8 - CNN Currents. "Suicide Survivors." 9 - "Sonya, Live in Los Angeles; Roe VS Wade, Smeal VS Schafly."

did.unittitle: [Velvet Underground February 1993]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Overview of Velvet Underground (record label) concert. Includes footage of craft sale beforehand, including handmade jewelry, t-shirts, paintings, musical instruments, etc. and informal interviews with the creators and concert attendees. Also features setup footage/sound check before the concert. Sound cuts out intermittently in the beginning of the tape.

did.unittitle: [Dykes on Mikes May 1993; Comedy Central; k.d. lang]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comedic and musical performances at Dykes on Mikes, including Alix Dobkin, Kelly Conway, Becky Black, and Liz Montgomery. MC June Doyle discusses various support groups for women intermittently, including support for women with serious medical issues. / Comedy Central Radio Active Television interview with Sandra Bernhard, then her performance on "The A List" followed by Larry Amrose. An episode of "Out There Comedy," the first lesbian and gay comedy show with comics Susanne Westenhoffer, Phranc, Bob Smith, Mark Davis, and Marga Gomez. / Performance special and commentary by musician k.d. lang.

did.unittitle: [Alix Dobkin]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Musical performance by singer-songwriter Alix Dobkin from the Gay Cable Network. Presented by producer/TV personality Cheryl Nasser.

did.unittitle: [Diane Germain Interview]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brief interview from the "Our World" television program of Diane F. Germain, a psychiatric social worker and cartoonist. Presented by Jon Hoffman; interviewer Linda Gibbins.

did.unittitle: [Take the Power; Miscellaneous Gay Cable TV]
[Workshops; Lynn Lavner]
Woman was created to serve man. Lesbian feminist views. Source: Marilyn Murphy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Featuring Murphy, Germain, and Wolfe.

did.unittitle: Sonia Johnson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An informal talk (partially recorded). Original sleeve had the additional note (an alternate date): "Sonia Johnson 1/23/93 speaking at a private home. (First and last minutes missing). Bad Tape."

did.unittitle: Jean Conger Roast
Donna Smith - 5 Beta Compilation
Bar Dykes - 1st Meeting

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: History of L.A. Attached note reads "Amazing oral history of L.A. Dykes Bars, Sat March 7, 1991. Candid interviews with lesbians at the Mazer Archives by Degonia and other woman. Bars from 50's on in Los Angeles. Including bartender Barbara Kalish, who is living in Long Beach as of 2008 - interviewed by Marie Cartier. Bars Mentioned: Misfits, Culver City, 1974-75, Bobbie, Virginia, Marsha, Barbara, Anna, Helen. Star Room - Jo Heston (owner). Sister Suds, My Way > Washington Blvd. Gardena - had the real butch femme bars "The Club." Baseball teams mentioned too. Variety Pool & Tennis courts right on beach in Santa Monica. Canyon Club in Malibu. 1st Older LA Area Bars remembered."

did.unittitle: Mazer Lesbian Archives for ALMS (Compilation tape).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.p: Compilation: 11/12/92 Cammermeyer/Prime Time, 11/16/92 Cammermeyer/Larry King Live, 11/20/92 Gays in military/Nightline, 11/21/92 Saturday Night Live Skit - Gays in military, 11/24/92 CBS Evening News/Misc. Gays in military items, 1/6/93 Nightline on Colorado, Misc. Pieces, 1/26 Maria Shriver/First Person.

did.unittitle: OLOC (Old Lesbians Organizing for Change)
First OLOC Type Meeting: West Coast Celebration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note on tape reads: "4/24/87 Poss. First OLOC Type Meeting? West Coast Celebration. On this tape: Lisa Ben (Edythe Ede), Mable Hampton, Meryl Markham, Mina Meyer, Jackie Bridgewater?, Jean Adelman - speaking, Barbara McDonald - speaking about ageism." Label on tape reads "Sat A.M. - West Coast Celeb, Saturday Adelman & Mac Donald."

SCWU (Southern California Women for Understanding)

SCWU - Welcome to Our Lesbian World: A Lesbian Odyssey 1985 #6

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Label on tape reads "Property of June L. Mazer Lesbian Collection." Attached note reads "Fantastic Show Produced by Bunny Mac. Cast is key people in SCWU. Use entire tape for ALMS. 1986.

did.unittitle: Camp SCWU 1990: Herstory: Ivy Bottini, Donna Smith, and Robin Tyler

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note attached reads "Donna Smith, Born 1919. Talks about going to gay bars in L.A. in 1940. (Great Bar stories early). Robin Tyler. Ivy Bottini."
